website_summaries.verdict: By leaving off features such as a lock, lights or charge indicator, Razor misses an opportunity to make the E300 electric scooter a cheap transportation alternative, instead relegating it to leisure status.
pros: Fat pneumatic tires give the Razor E300 a comfortable, stable ride, and its low price makes it a decent value proposition
cons: The E300 is extremely basic, even lacking a battery charge indicator
The accelerator is difficult to modulate, and its chain drivetrain is very noisy

customer_reviews.title: If your budget is $200 - $300, you can find much better scooter everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: (-)The motor is extremely loud, maybe only my E300 was defective? (-)This scooter is not foldable + super heavy, so this does not even fit in to my SUV's cargo room. (-)The motor has only one-speed option - ON or OFF, so it is always MAX or zero power. (-)There is no indicator that tells you the remaining battery and the current speed. (-)There is no shock absorbed, so you better expect bumpy ride. If your budget is $200 - $300, you can find the better scooter with everything above covered. Therefore, I see no reason that I have to pick E300.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The wind blows my hair back and I feel so free and happy and carefree its hard to tell you with out ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson and didn't give it to him. I kept it and zip all over the place on it. I'm 65 so I get a few looks but it brings my childhood back to me and for that I'm grateful. The wind blows my hair back and I feel so free and happy and carefree its hard to tell you with out sounding sappy. When I'm buzzing around on this thing I feel like I don't have a problem in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it!! Santa brought my daughter the E200 for Christmas and she loved it. I gave it a try and it was so much fun that I had to get me one as well. I am 6'3" tall and weigh 240lbs. This thing carries me with no problem. I went with the E300 because of my size, the weight limit is 200lbs but like I said it carries me fine. I recommend that you inflate the tires to the proper psi before using it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandip S.

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter for teens/adults! Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in 5 minutes. Just screw the steering column in. Fast, quiet, only wish it came equipped with reflective tape for safey. Added that, lights and a bell. Purchased for college students and they love them so far. I rode it around myself (grandma) and it's a lot of fun! Too soon to tell how long the battery will hold up. Only issue might be locking it up. A small 6" u-lock around the curved bar between the handle stem and base seems to work but it hasn't been tested yet. Manual says not to store in temps below freezing so leaving them in the garage all winter is out of the question. Keep that in mind!
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Defect in Tire, battery replaced once after 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both this model and E300S, I had to replace the batter in this model last year. And replace inner tube twice in E300S (for girls). I discovered a wire loose inside the tire and it is damaging the inner tubes. It is clearly a manufacturing defect and the company rejected my request for replacement due to out of warrant.
customer_reviews.author: SKA (IL USA)

customer_reviews.title: Broken and stopped working after just five months!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this scooter since March 2018 and on August 31st 2018 it started making "clicking " noses then suddenly stopped working. It will not do anything. It turns on but tge throttle has no effect. This is ridiculous. I use this scooter at work because I have to park several blocks away and I have lupus. There is no reason why it had broken. It has not been mishandled and ice taken good care and made sure its charged properly. I am very disappointed for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: The gift was a hit with the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughters visited us in May and loved riding the motorized scooters we have. We purchased the Razor E300 for our oldest granddaughter's 13th birthday. We wanted a scooter that she could use for a long time and that had some power and range. She was happily surprise with her gift and the whole family has enjoyed riding it. We have two more granddaughters in this family and plan on buying one for them on their birthdays as well.
customer_reviews.author: CKH

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable. Adults will love this too.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old boy. He loves it. Goes about 15 mph (which is a moderate speed for a commuter cyclist). The day tires handle bumps well and it goes over grass and imperfect roads just great. Easily assembled. I weight 160 pounds and love riding this. I’ve even used it to travel about a 2 mile radius to run errands. Wish it had a key or way to lock it up. Also wish it had some battery indicator. Fits in the trunk of my SUV without any disassembly. Make sure your kid has a helmet, 15 mph is faster than you think (that’s a 4 minute mile!).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Spends more time broken and not working, Now the batteries seem to have gone after about 6 months of light use. Think hard b4 buying Got new batteries and still does not work. I should have never purchased this scooter.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old daughter. It works great and so easy to assemble. I've read some of the reviews and I must say I've been satisfied with my purchase and the tires were NOT flat and have been perfect. Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect scooter for my son!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an electric scooter for awhile now. My son is in sixth grade but tall for his age, so I wanted a scooter that would fit him for awhile and he could commute to school. This was the scooter that fits the bill. We only had to attach the handle bars and he was off and running. It is a huge hit, he just loves it! It took less then 3 minutes to get the hang of and now he's scooting like a pro. I think I need to get one myself.
customer_reviews.author: Little Man's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Does not meet specifications
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up to the specs. Charged for 36 hours went for first ride. Started to slow down after 1 mile. Could not make it up a moderate grade with out a manual foot assist. Re-charged again for 24+ hours. Same deal. If weighing 180# is an issue, then it should be stated in the specs.
customer_reviews.author: xfooey

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for my teenage son to scoot around the neighborhood. One problem, the chain is too long or the tensioner is not properly placed. The tensioner forces the chain into another of part of the chain right near the motor. The torque has caused the chain to derail several times. I shortened the chain, and bought a new tension spring . Fixed most of the problem
customer_reviews.author: Tina V

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for neighborhood trips
customer_reviews.text: I would say that it is a great choice, because it has good stand plate, inflatable tires and so many abilities to upgrade using spare parts that improves battery capacity, speed and so on. But there are some things that can disturb you in default mode. First of all, it is noisy, because it has chain drive. Then, speed handle is very tough to handle it, when you drive for a while. At last, it is very heavy. But for 200$+ it is the best choice with about 8 miles drive range and, of course, you can easily upgrade it by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Marat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Customer
customer_reviews.text: This scooter worked great for a few weeks then it stopped working. It was never used in an abnormal way. I contacted Razor and they sent me a new control module. No instructions came with it so thankfully I am handy. It still didn't work. Now they are sending a new motor. I'm a bit disappointed. It took 2 weeks for the first part to arrive and now another 2 weeks for the second part. I have a very sad boy in my house right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni513

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little scooter.
customer_reviews.text: Its a powerful scooter. It runs about 15 mph. I would not recommend this for young kids. My son who bought it is 9 but he is a tall stocky kid so he can manage it. Hes also rode electric scooters before. We bought it because of weight limit as opposed to others so that he could ride it longer as he gets bigger. My 200+ lb husband and adult son have ridden it too and it goes a little slower especially up hill but still keeps going. Would definitely recommend for especially for a little older kids. Battery lasts the usual amount of time about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Elias stinnett

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are really really fun! We got 2 to ride around over the 4th of July and I am glad we did! They can carry an adult 15+ miles an hour and they will run for a very long time. I am a big guy over 300lbs and it handled me chasing my little nephew around all weekend. Not fast enough to be scary but a blast to zoom around the neighborhood on. We have had 0 problems with them. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Suburban Guy

customer_reviews.title: it is a very fun functional scooter
customer_reviews.text: My older son loves how smooth and powerful his red razor is. I bought one earlier for my younger son for his birthday in blue and he loves his too. The only thing I wished they would have thought of is to make it glow in the dark at night for safety. I had my boys wear bright reflective clothes and helmets when they ride their scooters close to evening because of safety issues. Other then that, it is a very fun functional scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Randy O.

customer_reviews.title: Chain comes off
customer_reviews.text: This was really fun the first dozen times that my daughter used it. But the chain comes off frequently and it just is not safe :/ I am hoping that the company will help get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Broken but easily fixed
customer_reviews.text: The tension spring broke within a few (about 5-6) uses, but I called Razor and got a free warranty replacement of the part in 2 days. It took 10-15 minutes to swap the part and the scooter works great now. I'm waiting to see how long this new spring lasts - the original splintered (presumably due to more strain than the material could handle). My daughter (12) loves the scooter and rides it daily for fun.
customer_reviews.author: Escapee

customer_reviews.title: range great fer a week
customer_reviews.text: i used this scooter daily to go back forth to the cornor store not even a mile away and i consider myself lucky if i dont have to walk it back and it is flat as flat can be living in oklahoma the first week or so it would get me there and back and have a lot left to go not any more had it fer 4 months now got the upgraded batterys aswell same problem would be good fer about a week or 2 then crap out do not get this scooter if you plan on using it to go anywhere thats not around the block
customer_reviews.author: Nolan R. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Transportation for Teens not yet driving
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 14YO son who is 5'6" and 175#, he said he wanted something that is "motorized." Since he wasn't/isn't old enough to drive this was the next best thing. He gets around where he needs which is mostly to his friends house and back which is 3miles round trip up and down hill. After the ride time which is roughly about 60 minutes it will need a charge. The scooter is zippy, hefty, sturdy and great for older kids or adults.
customer_reviews.author: Karie Herring

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids
customer_reviews.text: Not horrible! Great for kids.y kids are still a little to young for something like this. I had to return them:( I die t have the boxes and they still took them back after 4 days. I did have to buy a box to put them in to send them back but even slightly used. (Less than one change) they took them back with no hassles.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Fun with no pavement :)
customer_reviews.text: Our kids both got one of these scooters for Christmas, and since I hadn't seen them in person before buying, I was a little nervous. They have been wonderful! They charged easily, the kids flew around the campground for a week (sandy soil and grass, and did just fine). Even with a good charge they wouldn't carry the kids up a little hill (both weigh about 80 lbs), but my husband and I also rode around on them and love them. We haven't had them long enough to really test how well they hold up. But, so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: cls3442

customer_reviews.title: Weighs a Ton - Not for commuting
customer_reviews.text: It’s inappropriate to help you commute which is why I bought it. It weighs a ton so had to be returned. I never drove it but the lettering on the side of the scooter was faded not freshly painted AND the wheels showed wear. Obviously it had been purchased used them returned before
customer_reviews.author: Julialynn psychic

customer_reviews.title: Go stop controls, it is either full throttle, or rear brake.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for getting to work and back. The best part about it is how little space it takes up. It is way more convienent than racking my bike on the ceiling every morning. Unfortunately, the front tire is missalined on the rim from the factory, and the deck is a little weak. I've already put several dents in it with my work boots. I would describe it as a good mode of transport, but I would still have a back up plan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 11 year old! It’s amazing, battery does last a little bit more if breaks are taken in between use. If used straight for 45 mins then the battery will die. Very sturdy, comfortable, tires are awesome, it can be used in pavement and grass. Very happy with the purchase. It is a bit heavy if you’re loading it, but nothing that one person can’t handle. This was designed for heavy duty use, not your typical little kid scooter. Runs pretty fast, so if you’re looking for something slower and smaller kids I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery.
customer_reviews.text: The scooter battery needed to be replaced after One (1) month having stored the scooter in my garage in winter. If you do. It constant charge or recharge the battery, it simply stops working, especially at low temperatures. The customer service simply said “bad luck”. The scooter itself is sturdy. The screws (to access the battery) are low quality and needed to be replaced too. Would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Uli Kubilke

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes but...
customer_reviews.text: Loud scooter to the point of people looking at you when riding it. Bettery dies very fast making it unreliable. I had to push it a few times to get back home. Range is not close to the 15 miles range advertised rather more like 7 miles. Stay away from this scooter!
customer_reviews.author: Fun in the Sun

customer_reviews.title: Good when working. Tensioner broke after 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: My sons love this but about a month after we receive this and just being used around the block for a few minutes at a time, the tensioner broke. Emailed razor for warranty. They said the part was likely defective. A week after the last email from them, still no parts shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando201

customer_reviews.title: Small tires and handle DOES NOT fold down....get the older E300!
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent product, but BUY THE WARRANTY. It will fail within a few months if your kids rides it regularly. The electric motor quit in four months on this one. And yes this "new" model E300 has smaller tires than the older model. The handle bar does not fold down like the older E300 either. I have an older 2012 E300 and much much happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Defective product, need to return or exchanged.
customer_reviews.text: My son use this scooter mainly to get from his university parking lot to his class room. Just a little over a month of use, my son noticed 3 small ball bearings just laying there by the rear wheel and said that previously when he was riding it, the acceleration is slow and making pretty loud noise. I took it for a ride myself and also noticed the loud noise coming from the rear wheel. Scooter took a crap after a month of use. Need a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Chain Tension bar/spring
customer_reviews.text: Over all it is a great scooter for my 10 year old son. The only down fall I have had to deal with is the chain tension spring has broken twice in less than 6 months. He rides the Scooter in our neighborhood roads and has ridden over the driveway / road 1" transition bump and twice now the spring has broken. When this happens the scooter is inoperable until I get a new tension bar/spring for $10. Not sure who designed the spring but it should be made of a stronger metal material. Otherwise it's good. Just be prepared to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Woody Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Good but big & heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scooter for the most part. Battery lasts long, it can hold my 6' teenage son, it's easy to maneuver and control... The things I wish I had looked into more closely as it would have affected my buying decision - weight and easy of transport. We live on the second floor of our unit so this has to be carried up & down stairs when we want to use it. It is a bit heavy. I also would have liked it if we could fold it up to take on trips/vacations. It's a good item, just wish I had taken the time to read more thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but original failed prematurely. Maintenance unfriendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 9th birthday. Works great and has alot of power. Surprised it could handle hills. Also pretty fast. Definitely don't buy for a child younger than 12 or with poor hand-eye coordination. Unfortunately, whether due to a couple of cold nights or moisture my first one stopped working. MAINTENANCE BEWARE: Rear tire failures are very hard to fix. Not easy at all replacing the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Loving it.
customer_reviews.text: The scooter arrived yesterday. Everything came in one piece except the handle needed to be assembled which was the easiest thing. Took a test ride yesterday, it felt good. I was concerned about riding it uphill but it worked just fine and picked up the speed quite well. Love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rasha

customer_reviews.title: Whatever it takes to get the kids outside and off the screens
customer_reviews.text: After a shaky start, I have to rate this scooter as solid. Purchased for a 10 year old boy and he rides it a lot. The chain tensioner on the other hand is fragile. We've been through 3 in a year and a half, but they are easy to change. Don't expect long rides or going uphill often as the battery drains somewhat quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John Wick and Dani California

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY, POOR SUPPORT!
customer_reviews.text: The chain tensioner spring broke around mid October after JUST 10 hours of use. Contacted support right away but was notified that the spring was back-ordered. It is now November 23 and still no spring... How much longer will it take? Scooter weather is gone now, is Razor going to extend my warranty? After all the scooter is just sitting there unusable for over a month... Based on the fact that the spring broke so fast and that it is back-ordered shows that it is of poor quality/design and as a result has a high failure rate. Razor, you have to do MUCH better! We're NOT impressed, AT ALL!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Z.

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, but heavy & noisy
customer_reviews.text: Solid scooter, almost too solid. It is way heavier than the Birds/Limes I've ridden in the past. It is noisy, but I didn't purchase for commuting so I can't speak very well on battery life. I'm small with small hands, so I ran into an issue of the brake on the handle was a little too big for me, but I wanted to get the E300 so it would be able to my weight. It's fine, but maybe I should have splurged on something sleeker.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Decent first ride, not so much after
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the ride the first time I used it. I had about a three mile commute to work at 5am, and the scooter worked fine for that. Subsequent rides, however, showed a problem. There was a problem with either the throttle or with the battery. Perhaps I hit something on the way to work, as I was unable to ride it home. I would recommend that riders also purchase a helmet, as it hits its top speed in only a few seconds, with no gradual increase in speed. Besides my own scooter's problems, I would say it is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelan

customer_reviews.title: It's fast!
customer_reviews.text: My kid rode a Byrd (rentable scooter) while we were on vacation last Thanksgiving. It was so much fun that I got this one for her as a Christmas gift. I was worried that the E100/200 would not go over grass or go fast enough, so I got thhis one. It has large pneumatic tires and it's almost as fast as the Byrd. My kid is VERY happy.
customer_reviews.author: David Cavazos

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Razor for my grandson on 3/28/2020. He has not been able to use it it will not run. the battery is fully charged but nothing. We are withing the 90 day warranty and I have contacted the manufacture still waithg to hear..very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn A. Bender

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my girlfriend and it moves her 98 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend and it moves her 98 lbs around effortlessly. I've used it a few times and it seems to struggle a little with my 195 lb butt on even slight inclines, but on flat terrain it really gets moving.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Williams

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this scooter. THE TENSION WILL BREAK EASILY. The part is on back order from the manufacture for months. I have had the scooter broken longer than I have owned it working easily. It broke in the first month. Still waiting on parts from Razor.
customer_reviews.author: El Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Scooter works great, surprisingly fast. Even with a 200 pound rider! Wish it was a little cheaper, but good quality.
customer_reviews.author: bizzy

customer_reviews.title: A powerful scooter
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the back wheel and chain tensioner/spring within a couple of months of having the scooter. It is a good scooter, packed with power, provided it is working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy. Not enough power for slopes. Not a commuter
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an electric scooter to do my 2 mile commute, but this one isn't going to work out. Im 5'10'' 155lb. The scooter does not climb slopes well. Its heavy. The handlebars are a bit low. It has one speed only, max speed. Not too fast. You can not gradually increase or decrease speed. I decided to keep it because its a fun ride, but I won't use for commute or convenience.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Morelli

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase; exactly what my son wanted
customer_reviews.text: My 96lb, 5'5" son loves his Razor! Rides it quite a bit, and charges it as needed. The only thing is it's pretty heavy so I make sure I help him move it up and down the deck stairs and bringing it inside. It goes peetty fast and handles really well.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: But I bought it anyway and am so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I was so worried about buying this after reading some reviews. But I bought it anyway and am so glad I did. Big hit for Christmas morning! My 11 year old loves it. It's now Valentine's Day and so far we've experienced no problems. I'm kind of expecting to have problems with the battery, and at that point I will just buy a new battery. But so far, no problems. I was a little worried about safety, too. It took two minutes of him riding it for me to get over that. It's just a little scooter! Anyway, lots of fun. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Kabul Glaze

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing scooter for my 12 year old son. He was able to assemble it very easily and it charged with no issues. We haven't had it long but so far it's been an awesome experience. It is heavy but he is strong as it needs to be. The tires are a great size, much to some complaints. I did purchase additional protection on it just to be on the safe side. Highly recommend it for any kid with scooter experience and over the age of 10. Razor is still the best for scooters in our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Celia Timms

customer_reviews.title: Used not New like described
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm giving a 3 instead of higher is because the scooter was obviously used, The box was opened on resealed in messy condition and the scooter had scratches. I didn't return it because I needed it for my 13 yr old's birthday in 2 day. Fortunately, it has been working well for almost 1 month and my kid is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built and fun
customer_reviews.text: My teen grand-daughter really likes it, and often rides it together with her 11 yr old younger brother who totally LOVES it!!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor enthusiast in NH

customer_reviews.title: The battery capacity doesn't allow you to go for more than 4-5 miles but great for shorter trips
customer_reviews.text: Decent entry level scooter at reasonable price. The battery capacity doesn't allow you to go for more than 4-5 miles but great for shorter trips. It goes fairly fast and is easy to use. The thick wheels are nice and give a smooth ride. As the scooter is chain driven, there is chain noise, so it is not the quietest ride but in some ways, you do want people to know you are coming, for your own safety.
customer_reviews.author: cardpro

customer_reviews.title: only one speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scooter for commuting into work when I had to walk far from my car (arthritic feet). It worked great. I also wanted to use it to help walk my dog. It is difficult to use it for this because it only goes one speed, too fast for my dog. It would be nice to be able to go slower without the jerking of the throttle on and off. Otherwise it is fun for just going around the neighborhood. Wide tire makes it safer for bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This scooter has not held up very well at all Chain routinely falls off when riding it Bearings went out in the front wheel after 2 months The automatic chain tensioner is very weak Would Not Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Thia scooter was more than I expected for $200. Razor makes decent products, but I am 6'4" and 280 lbs. It won't go up steep hills with me on it, but does a good job otherwise. Air filled tires are a plus for handling bumps and minimal assembly was required. It comes with the only tool needed for assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Great & Fun
customer_reviews.text: Great product for kids & even adults. Very fun! Battery life last a good deal of time before having to charge it up.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: 300 series the scooter
customer_reviews.text: I like to scooter it runs pretty well but I didn't do my homework that's what I dislike cuz I could have got to 3:25 which would have been a little bit better and now they have another one that folds that's the one I wanted like I said I should have done my homework a little more but it's a good product no complaints
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: It died 20 minutes after using it. I was not given a refund or replacement. They gave me a new battery but that didn’t help. I tried telling them but then they tried to sell me a $50 electric kit.
customer_reviews.author: Saima

customer_reviews.title: Came broken and dented
customer_reviews.text: The front tire came flat, with a hole so we have to get it replaced. Ergo, it won’t be ready In time for the birthday party. Also the standing platform came scratched and dented. I’m so irritated.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Miller

customer_reviews.title: So far so GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered another electric scooter that we returned because it did nothing near what it advertised. We spent a little more money for the razor 300 and my son is ecstatic. He says his scooter is a "beast". This scooter goes up hills and fast without him having to get off. When dad (190 pounds) gets on things change drastically but my 70 pound son is loving life!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it it’s fast and is way better with the big back wheel . Run time is also pretty decent . Seems built pretty good the other one we had broke after a year so got the warranty . Also bought a dune buggy and the battery went bad after a year .
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fast and well built!
customer_reviews.text: The scooter is awesome! My son loved it. We bought the item approximately two years ago and my son is 10, still rides it. We even take it on some trips.
customer_reviews.author: Robinson, E

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. But I wish they add a battery level indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Igor M

customer_reviews.title: wait for the color you like
customer_reviews.text: it grate to ride and smooth and fast if do not stay on the throttle the battery last a lot longer the expected I would like to have a power meter to let you know when the battery are getting low and let you know when to conserve the power
customer_reviews.author: Franklin D Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good product - first delivered poorly and questions about storage.
customer_reviews.text: The first one that arrived I had to send back. The box was in terrible condition and when picked graphite was pouring out. I didn't bother to open it and sent it back right away. The second one that came in was in much better condition. My some loves it and has a blast on it. However, on disappointing thing is the user manual states not to store it in temperatures below 32 degrees. This makes absolutely no sense. It's an outdoor item and though it's garage kept (attached garage) the garage is not heated. Why in the world would they expect it to be kept somewhere warm??
customer_reviews.author: Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy And Battery lasts 250 Charges.
customer_reviews.text: Works but the fine print, is very important. As per fine print, "The battery lasts only 250 charges". So say 1 year, if you use it 5 days a week. That puts the cost at $1 a charge, which is say 10 miles. Fun to ride, Manageable speed and sturdy product
customer_reviews.author: Mahesh R. Rajannan

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not that good
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not that great...my Grandaughters have small scooters that outlast this one....
customer_reviews.author: Miss La

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old bought one with his money & it was so cool I bought one, too! Then our 11 & 10 year olds used their savings, too! The only downside is that even being no where near the weight limit & it goes painfully slow with me on it - compared to the kids.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was fun at first. Went pretty fast for my 7 year old and he loved it. In the 3 months my son has been using it, a chain kept falling off repeatedly due to a spring breaking already. The company did send a new part for free. But now it won't go at full speed. Disappointing considering the cost. I wouldn't recommend. My son no longer rides due to the issues it has.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Presley

customer_reviews.title: terrible packaging, arrived totally open and busted with holes ...
customer_reviews.text: terrible packaging, arrived totally open and busted with holes in the box.tape strip to hold flaps closed also undone should have straps around it due the the item being so heavy. Very fast and great, my 10 year old stole it from me so i had to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Greene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting around Campus!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to get me from one side of campus to another and this is perfect for it. I am adding a 9 tooth sprocket to the motor because its already super fast but it just needs more low end power. The new sprocket will give me more torque for getting up some hills!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Wrong charger, incomplete tools, etc
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived! Needs two screws to attach handle bars to base, only came with one screw. Charger is the wrong size. Received a manual for compact unit heater. Pics attached. Thanks for ruining my weekend.🖕
customer_reviews.author: K-Bow

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. The scooter deck arrived with multiple scratches
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The scooter deck arrived with multiple scratches, as though it was used. The side of the deck is worn, other scratches throughout the frame. I was going to overlook this and just try the scooter, but the front tire is popped and there is no valve extender for the rear tire. So sad... I am returning today.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen James

customer_reviews.title: Constructed well and worth the few extra bucks for the 300
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for 4 months now and my 8 year old loves this thing. rides it all around the neighborhood. No complaints, Charger works as it should tires are still nice and constructed very well. I'm glad I spent a few more bucks for the 300.
customer_reviews.author: chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Goes really fast and doesn’t start out slow but fun for not a tiny kid
customer_reviews.text: Goes really fast and doesn’t start out slow but fun for not a tiny kid
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good purchase for a 12 year old girl. lots of miles and still going a year later. sorry for late review but I read the reviews and purchased and very glad that I did.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Replacing the rear tube is an undertaking as well as the replacement batteries are not factory and will also go bad rapidly (hav
customer_reviews.text: Had this for one month. Battery does not last longer than 10 minutes and tube has already gone flat (nothing punctured into the tire upon inspection). Replacing the rear tube is an undertaking as well as the replacement batteries are not factory and will also go bad rapidly (have other razor products). On top of that, the time for returns expired right when we gave this to our daughter as a present. It is hit or miss with Razor and this new product is crap and we have not recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed about this
customer_reviews.text: Can’t keep the steering tiller tight. Used two wrenches to tighten the double nut but it loosened after a short ride. Nothing in the owner’s manual tells how to adjust it properly. Very disappointed about this. Otherwise I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore L. Novetzke

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but not durable or powerful
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 10 year old daughter and she loves riding it! However, it is not powerful on hills and it does not hold up well at all. In less than two months it stopped working and we had to replace chain tensioner. We live in a hilly neighborhood and the scooter struggles to get up with an 85 lb. rider. I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Vail

customer_reviews.title: It's a good scooter
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for 14 year old grandson, and he likes it. His father rode it more, him being about a hundred and fifty pounds. The battery seem to last longer when it was just my grandson riding it, him weighing about 100 lbs. Speed was good for this scooter. Have it for close to two years, it still runs, but not as good.
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Not anywhere close to 15 MPH
customer_reviews.text: The throttle is not....it might as well be a button, because you twist to a certain point and the scooter goes to "full" throttle, there is no metering of power. Unfortunately, full throttle (on) accelerates very slowly to 10 MPH max, no where close to the 15 MPH claim. I guess I should've read the fine print which says UP TO 15 MPH, which could mean 1 MPH and they'd still be making good on their statement.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: WAY too loud, the battery life is meh, it last for about 2 hours but survived not being charged for weeks. It cannot support a 200 pound man but is great for people who are 50 - 150 pounds
customer_reviews.author: Berkley

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter my 13 year-old son really enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: Great scooter my 13 year-old son really enjoys it. It holds his weight well and he's about 150. Comes assembled. And still working since Christmas which is a big plus .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought thos on Sept 2019 it has been flat tire after 1 month , i replace inner tibe 4x now and its cost money . I do not reccomend low quality tire, even the battery is not as it claims. I have to walk after 15mins rides
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, returned two
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these and returned both. One of them was badly damaged upon arrival. The other one could not hold a charge at all. Very difficult to return. Would never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to charge and ride
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! Holds a charge well and runs well.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Solves my problem! :)
customer_reviews.text: Solves my problem! :) I don't have a car and wont be able to buy one soon. I wanted something which will use less space and which wont require any license. Works really well. Needs only 4-5 hours of charging for 3-4 mile ride (Bought it last month).
customer_reviews.author: Nishigandha

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good my daughter has been riding it almost daily’s since Christmas
customer_reviews.author: MrsZat

customer_reviews.title: Good for my 8 yr old and me.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I bought it for my daughter, but I end up using it a lot. It’s big enough that I don’t feel stupid riding it. 6’1” about 190 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Sammy58

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Scooter!
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson age 11 received this scooter for Christmas and he absolutely loves it! Out in the sunshine he goes and I love that! The scooter is extremely well made and with the weight limit, we believe he will enjoy it for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, fast, and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scooter, my son loves it. It's a lot bigger/ heavier than I thought it would be but at least it will last him a long time. Also it zooms pretty fast so definitely need a helmet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it !
customer_reviews.text: Living outside the US Amazon and its reviews are my go to for gifts for my grandson. This scooter caught my eye so of course had to read everything on each model. There was no doubt he would love it but the parents could be a problem. Bottom line, he loves it and they're ok with it. Helmet is a must. Son in law said assembly was quick and easy with no problems or missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: nancy bean

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, after a few days of use, the paper clip sized spring that keeps the chain taut broke. I sent it back, and the 2nd one did the same thing. My daughter has the smaller version of this, and there's no problems with that one.
customer_reviews.author: unbeliever

customer_reviews.title: You may need a new battery the minute you get it just FYI
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap!! Right out of the box with 14 hour charge and battery doesn’t work and I have to fix the problem myself!! What a joke amazon! Products fresh out of the box should work! This is awful as I am a faithful amazon customer and card holder!!
customer_reviews.author: George hamel

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on a Tuesday and on Thursday it showed delivered. Got home to find a desk instead of a scooter obviously a fulfillment screw up. The replacement came on Saturday and after a full charge tried it out. First it definitely does not do 15 miles per hour. Secondly it is nice and quiet and smooth ride once I inflated the tires. My seven-year-old seems to like it so I guess that's what all that matters. On a different note I think it's past time that razor upgrade their technology to lithium-ion batteries. 12 hour charging time is just unacceptable in today's day and age.
customer_reviews.author: fresh

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter
customer_reviews.text: I've been very impressed with the quality and durability of this scooter. We debated on which model to get and I'm very happy I went with the E300 as it's a little bigger and has more power. We live on a fairly steep hill and my son is able to ride up a few blocks to his friends house without any issues. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pre-teens!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 11 year olds birthday. Was a hit! She loves it. I really like that she will be able to use this for a few years. It has great power and even my husband and I have taken it for a ride or two. Fast shipping and easy to assemble by myself. Easy to follow instructions. Only have had for a week but this is looking like a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ChickyWidget

customer_reviews.title: runs down fast
customer_reviews.text: only complaint i have is that these scooters do not hold a charge long. an hour tops and they have to charge again.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle L Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun
customer_reviews.text: Simple can’t stop riding this! My kids and I love taking this out! I first bought it because of the difficulties of parking but now that I’m not having this problem I just use it for fun! I just wish it was better on uphills but other than that, Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Harris

product_meta.title: Razor E300 Electric Scooter
feature_bullets: Up to 40 minutes of continuous use .Max weight 220 Pounds
Features rear wheel drive for increased traction and control

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
